verses.text_plain: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.
verses.verse_html:
1I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me. ▼
▼ my mouth…: Heb. a bridle, or, muzzle for my mouth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my mouth…: Heb. a bridle, or, muzzle for my mouth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my mouth…: Heb. a bridle, or, muzzle for my mouth

verses.text_plain: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.
verses.verse_html:
2I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred. ▼
▼ stirred: Heb. troubled

verses.text_plain: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,
verses.verse_html: 3My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,

verses.text_plain: Lord, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.
verses.verse_html:
4Lord, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am. ▼
▼ how…: or, what time I have here

footnotes.body_text: ▼ how…: or, what time I have here
footnotes.body_html: ▼ how…: or, what time I have here

verses.text_plain: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
verses.verse_html:
5Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah. ▼
▼ at…: Heb. settled

tokens.text: as nothing before thee: verily every

verses.text_plain: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
verses.verse_html:
6Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them. ▼
▼ a vain…: Heb. an image

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a vain…: Heb. an image

verses.text_plain: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.
verses.verse_html: 7And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.

verses.text_plain: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.
verses.verse_html: 8Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

verses.text_plain: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.
verses.verse_html: 9I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.

verses.text_plain: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.
verses.verse_html:
10Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand. ▼
▼ blow: Heb. conflict

verses.text_plain: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
verses.verse_html:
11When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah. ▼
▼ his…: Heb. that which is to be desired in him to melt away

footnotes.body_text: ▼ his…: Heb. that which is to be desired in him to melt away
footnotes.body_html: ▼ his…: Heb. that which is to be desired in him to melt away

verses.text_plain: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
verses.verse_html: 12Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

verses.text_plain: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.
verses.verse_html: 13O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.

tokens.text: me, that I may recover strength
